text.headline: Club on Kona Kohala Coast
text.text:
Ouli Farms is a 840 acre development located on the Kohala coast on Kona, the Big Island of Hawaii. The property is just above the Mauna Kea Resort. The site was originally part of the parcel acquired by the Rockefeller family for the resort. The development will include approximately 140 homes leaving over 200 acres of active farms. Each home includes an acre as an active farm contributing to the food production on the island. The farms will be managed by a team of experienced farmers producing a variety of fruits, vegetables, and flowers. In addition to the homes and farms, Ouli Farms will also include a community club. The club will offer a variety of amenities, such as a swimming pool, tennis courts, and a fitness center.

Ouli Farms is designed to prioritize sustainability and environmental stewardship. Minimizing its impact on the environment, residents will use sustainable practices throughout. Homes will be built with energy-efficient materials, and the farms will be managed using organic methods.

The Kohala Coast of Kona is known for its sunny, dry weather with an average annual rainfall of 10 inches. The climate is mild with average temperatures from 70 degrees Fahrenheit in the winter to 80 degrees Fahrenheit in the summer.
